line: Why, how now! what does Master Fenton here?

line: Come, Master Shallow; come, son Slender, in.

line: accusative, hung, hang, hog.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: 'Hang-hog' is Latin for bacon, I warrant you.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: Leave your prabbles, 'oman. What is the focative

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: case, William?

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
line: O,--vocativo, O.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: Remember, William; focative is caret.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: And that's a good root.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: 'Oman, forbear.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Peace!

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: What is your genitive case plural, William?

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
line: Genitive case!

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: Ay.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
line: Genitive,--horum, harum, horum.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: Vengeance of Jenny's case! fie on her! never name

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: her, child, if she be a whore.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: For shame, 'oman.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: You do ill to teach the child such words: he

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: teaches him to hick and to hack, which they'll do

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS QUICKLY
line: fast enough of themselves, and to call 'horum:' fie upon you!

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: 'Oman, art thou lunatics? hast thou no

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: understandings for thy cases and the numbers of the

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: genders? Thou art as foolish Christian creatures as

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: I would desires.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Prithee, hold thy peace.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: Show me now, William, some declensions of your pronouns.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: WILLIAM PAGE
line: Forsooth, I have forgot.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: It is qui, quae, quod: if you forget your 'quies,'

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: your 'quaes,' and your 'quods,' you must be

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: preeches. Go your ways, and play; go.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: He is a better scholar than I thought he was.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: He is a good sprag memory. Farewell, Mistress Page.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Adieu, good Sir Hugh.

scene: SCENE I.  A street.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Get you home, boy. Come, we stay too long.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Mistress Ford, your sorrow hath eaten up my

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: sufferance. I see you are obsequious in your love,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: and I profess requital to a hair's breadth; not

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: only, Mistress Ford, in the simple

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: office of love, but in all the accoutrement,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: complement and ceremony of it. But are you

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: sure of your husband now?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: He's a-birding, sweet Sir John.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Within  What, ho, gossip Ford! what, ho!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Step into the chamber, Sir John.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: How now, sweetheart! who's at home besides yourself?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Why, none but mine own people.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Indeed!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: No, certainly.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Speak louder.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Truly, I am so glad you have nobody here.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Why?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Why, woman, your husband is in his old lunes again:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: he so takes on yonder with my husband; so rails

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: against all married mankind; so curses all Eve's

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: daughters, of what complexion soever; and so buffets

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: himself on the forehead, crying, 'Peer out, peer

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: out!' that any madness I ever yet beheld seemed but

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: tameness, civility and patience, to this his

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: distemper he is in now: I am glad the fat knight is not here.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Why, does he talk of him?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Of none but him; and swears he was carried out, the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: last time he searched for him, in a basket; protests

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: to my husband he is now here, and hath drawn him and

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: the rest of their company from their sport, to make

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: another experiment of his suspicion: but I am glad

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: the knight is not here; now he shall see his own foolery.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: How near is he, Mistress Page?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Hard by; at street end; he will be here anon.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: I am undone! The knight is here.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Why then you are utterly shamed, and he's but a dead

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: man. What a woman are you!--Away with him, away

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: with him! better shame than murder.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Which way should be go? how should I bestow him?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Shall I put him into the basket again?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: No, I'll come no more i' the basket. May I not go

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: out ere he come?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Alas, three of Master Ford's brothers watch the door

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: with pistols, that none shall issue out; otherwise

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: you might slip away ere he came. But what make you here?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: What shall I do? I'll creep up into the chimney.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: There they always use to discharge their

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: birding-pieces. Creep into the kiln-hole.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Where is it?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: He will seek there, on my word. Neither press,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: coffer, chest, trunk, well, vault, but he hath an

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: abstract for the remembrance of such places, and

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: goes to them by his note: there is no hiding you in the house.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I'll go out then.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: If you go out in your own semblance, you die, Sir

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: John. Unless you go out disguised--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: How might we disguise him?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Alas the day, I know not! There is no woman's gown

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: big enough for him otherwise he might put on a hat,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: a muffler and a kerchief, and so escape.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Good hearts, devise something: any extremity rather

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: than a mischief.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: My maid's aunt, the fat woman of Brentford, has a

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: gown above.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: On my word, it will serve him; she's as big as he

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: is: and there's her thrummed hat and her muffler

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: too. Run up, Sir John.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Go, go, sweet Sir John: Mistress Page and I will

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: look some linen for your head.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Quick, quick! we'll come dress you straight: put

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: on the gown the while.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: I would my husband would meet him in this shape: he

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: cannot abide the old woman of Brentford; he swears

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: she's a witch; forbade her my house and hath

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: threatened to beat her.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Heaven guide him to thy husband's cudgel, and the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: devil guide his cudgel afterwards!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: But is my husband coming?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Ah, in good sadness, is he; and talks of the basket

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: too, howsoever he hath had intelligence.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: We'll try that; for I'll appoint my men to carry the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: basket again, to meet him at the door with it, as

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: they did last time.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Nay, but he'll be here presently: let's go dress him

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: like the witch of Brentford.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: I'll first direct my men what they shall do with the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: basket. Go up; I'll bring linen for him straight.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Hang him, dishonest varlet! we cannot misuse him enough.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: We'll leave a proof, by that which we will do,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Wives may be merry, and yet honest too:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: We do not act that often jest and laugh;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: 'Tis old, but true, Still swine eat all the draff.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Go, sirs, take the basket again on your shoulders:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: your master is hard at door; if he bid you set it

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: down, obey him: quickly, dispatch.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: First Servant
line: Come, come, take it up.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: Second Servant
line: Pray heaven it be not full of knight again.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: First Servant
line: I hope not; I had as lief bear so much lead.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Ay, but if it prove true, Master Page, have you any

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: way then to unfool me again? Set down the basket,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: villain! Somebody call my wife. Youth in a basket!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: O you panderly rascals! there's a knot, a ging, a

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: pack, a conspiracy against me: now shall the devil

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: be shamed. What, wife, I say! Come, come forth!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Behold what honest clothes you send forth to bleaching!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: PAGE
line: Why, this passes, Master Ford; you are not to go

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: PAGE
line: loose any longer; you must be pinioned.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: Why, this is lunatics! this is mad as a mad dog!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: Indeed, Master Ford, this is not well, indeed.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: So say I too, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Come hither, Mistress Ford; Mistress Ford the honest

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: woman, the modest wife, the virtuous creature, that

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: hath the jealous fool to her husband! I suspect

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: without cause, mistress, do I?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Heaven be my witness you do, if you suspect me in

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: any dishonesty.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Well said, brazen-face! hold it out. Come forth, sirrah!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: PAGE
line: This passes!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Are you not ashamed? let the clothes alone.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: I shall find you anon.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: 'Tis unreasonable! Will you take up your wife's

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: clothes? Come away.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Empty the basket, I say!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Why, man, why?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Master Page, as I am a man, there was one conveyed

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: out of my house yesterday in this basket: why may

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: not he be there again? In my house I am sure he is:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: my intelligence is true; my jealousy is reasonable.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Pluck me out all the linen.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: If you find a man there, he shall die a flea's death.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: PAGE
line: Here's no man.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: By my fidelity, this is not well, Master Ford; this

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SHALLOW
line: wrongs you.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: Master Ford, you must pray, and not follow the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: SIR HUGH EVANS
line: imaginations of your own heart: this is jealousies.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Well, he's not here I seek for.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: PAGE
line: No, nor nowhere else but in your brain.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Help to search my house this one time. If I find

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: not what I seek, show no colour for my extremity; let

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: me for ever be your table-sport; let them say of

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: me, 'As jealous as Ford, Chat searched a hollow

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: walnut for his wife's leman.' Satisfy me once more;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: once more search with me.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: What, ho, Mistress Page! come you and the old woman

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: down; my husband will come into the chamber.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Old woman! what old woman's that?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Nay, it is my maid's aunt of Brentford.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: A witch, a quean, an old cozening quean! Have I not

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: forbid her my house? She comes of errands, does

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: she? We are simple men; we do not know what's

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: brought to pass under the profession of

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: fortune-telling. She works by charms, by spells,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: by the figure, and such daubery as this is, beyond

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: our element we know nothing. Come down, you witch,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: you hag, you; come down, I say!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: Nay, good, sweet husband! Good gentlemen, let him

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS FORD
line: not strike the old woman.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Come, Mother Prat; come, give me your hand.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: I'll prat her.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: Out of my door, you witch, you hag, you baggage, you

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: polecat, you runyon! out, out! I'll conjure you,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: FORD
line: I'll fortune-tell you.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Are you not ashamed? I think you have killed the

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: poor woman.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in FORD'S house.

line: Heaven give you many, many merry days!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Good husband, let us every one go home,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: And laugh this sport o'er by a country fire;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.
speaker: MISTRESS PAGE
line: Sir John and all.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.
speaker: FORD
line: Let it be so. Sir John,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.
speaker: FORD
line: To Master Brook you yet shall hold your word

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the Park.
speaker: FORD
line: For he tonight shall lie with Mistress Ford.
